name: Nana Dot's Irish Soda Bread
author: JerzPixelPusher
summary: This was my mom's mothers recipe (my Nana Dot) and has been passed down for generations, direct from Ireland.  If you like soda bread, this is awesome!
ingredients: ½ cup butter, cut into pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Stir together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a large bowl until evenly blended
Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or your hands until the mixture resembles coarse cornmeal
Stir in the raisins, currants, and caraway seeds, then make a well in the center and pour in the milk and vinegar
Stir with a spoon until the dry ingredients are moistened
Turn the dough out onto a well floured work surface, and knead gently 8 to 10 times
Divide the dough into two balls, and place onto the prepared baking sheets
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C), and bake until the top of the bread is golden brown, about 15 minutes more
